snippet.textDisplay:
I mean, they're really different games. Earthbound is a traditional turn based RPG, while Undertale is turn based bullet hell. Undertale is great because of how dense the narrative content is, and how much it responds to player input. Earthbound is great because it has interesting aesthetics and music and a solid RPG story, especially for the time it was released. One does not devalue the other.

And I understand why you brought up the Call of Duty thing, but that has absolutely zero relevance in this conversation.
snippet.textOriginal:
I mean, they're really different games. Earthbound is a traditional turn based RPG, while Undertale is turn based bullet hell. Undertale is great because of how dense the narrative content is, and how much it responds to player input. Earthbound is great because it has interesting aesthetics and music and a solid RPG story, especially for the time it was released. One does not devalue the other.

And I understand why you brought up the Call of Duty thing, but that has absolutely zero relevance in this conversation.

snippet.textDisplay:
Better yet, play Tomato's MOTHER 1 + 2 fan translation.

Sure, the music is slightly worse, but the translation is MUCH better and there's also an option for less difficulty in the form of an equippable Easy Ring. Really the definitive version of the game, hands down.

snippet.textDisplay: Of course it is, it's the first installment. But it really is quite similar to EarthBound (Mother 2). Although their storylines are similar, EarthBound to me is the more superior. Its controlling and everything is better, and it's easier (Mother 1 was originally VERY challenging and required lotsa grinding). Even though EB has grinding and stuff, it's still easier. I recommend it for the novice Mother player. :) Hope that sells ya, if you were thinking of buying it :)
snippet.textOriginal: Of course it is, it's the first installment. But it really is quite similar to EarthBound (Mother 2). Although their storylines are similar, EarthBound to me is the more superior. Its controlling and everything is better, and it's easier (Mother 1 was originally VERY challenging and required lotsa grinding). Even though EB has grinding and stuff, it's still easier. I recommend it for the novice Mother player. :) Hope that sells ya, if you were thinking of buying it :)

snippet.textDisplay:
MOTHER was released in Japan only for the NES.
The second game in the series is known as MOTHER2 in Japan, but EarthBound in North America because it was the first MOTHER game released there.
MOTHER3 was released in Japan only on the GBA, but there's an excellent fan translation online that can allow you to play the game fully in English using an emulator.
snippet.textOriginal:
MOTHER was released in Japan only for the NES.
The second game in the series is known as MOTHER2 in Japan, but EarthBound in North America because it was the first MOTHER game released there.
MOTHER3 was released in Japan only on the GBA, but there's an excellent fan translation online that can allow you to play the game fully in English using an emulator.

snippet.textDisplay: Super nostalgic theme. I tried a NES emulator for the first time when I learned that this game existed, I was still pretty new with computers back then so it was quite the challenge to make it work. It was in japanese since the translation wasn't out yet, but simply seeing the title screen pop out﻿ with this theme playing made me overly excited. This music playing near the end of Mother 3 was also a great moment.
snippet.textOriginal: Super nostalgic theme. I tried a NES emulator for the first time when I learned that this game existed, I was still pretty new with computers back then so it was quite the challenge to make it work. It was in japanese since the translation wasn't out yet, but simply seeing the title screen pop out﻿ with this theme playing made me overly excited. This music playing near the end of Mother 3 was also a great moment.
